</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	termination of lock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;up agreements with our management team and principal stockholders;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the granting or exercise of employee stock options;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	volume of trading in our common stock; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	impact of the facts described elsewhere in &#x201C;Risk Factors.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, in recent years, the stock market has regularly experienced significant price and volume fluctuations. This volatility has had a significant impact on the market price of securities issued by many companies, including companies in our industry. The changes frequently appear to occur without regard to the operating performance of the affected companies. Hence, the price of our common stock could fluctuate based upon factors that have little or nothing to do with us and these fluctuations could materially reduce our share price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our majority stockholders have the ability to control significant corporate activities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Tricor Pacific Capital Partners (Fund IV), Limited Partnership and Tricor Pacific Capital Partners (Fund IV) US, Limited Partnership
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(collectively, the &#x201C;Tricor Funds&#x201D;), affiliated with Parallel49 Equity (formerly known as Tricor Pacific Capital), own approximately 36.5% and 21.6% of our common stock, respectively. As a result of their ownership, the Tricor Funds, so long as they collectively hold a majority of our outstanding shares, will have the ability to control the outcome of matters submitted to a vote of stockholders and, through our board of directors, the ability to control decision
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;making with respect to our business direction and policies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Matters over which the Tricor Funds, directly or indirectly, exercise control include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	election of directors;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mergers and other business combination transactions, including proposed transactions that would result in our stockholders receiving a premium price for their shares;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	other acquisitions or dispositions of businesses or assets;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	incurrence of indebtedness and the issuance of equity securities;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	repurchases of stock and payment of dividends; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the issuance of shares to management under our incentive plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Conflicts of interest may arise because directors who are principals of our largest stockholder constitute a substantial portion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	our board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Messrs.&nbsp;Seaman, Peters and Rowntree, who are officers or affiliates of Parallel49 Equity (and its predecessor), serve on our board of directors. The Tricor Funds, our majority stockholders, are funds controlled by Parallel49 Equity and its affiliates. Parallel49 Equity and entities controlled by it may in the future hold equity interests in entities that directly or indirectly compete with us, and companies in which it currently invests may begin directly or indirectly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	competing with us. As a result of these relationships, when conflicts between the interests of Parallel49 Equity, on the one hand, and of other stockholders, on the other hand, arise, these directors may not be disinterested. Although our directors and officers have a duty of loyalty to us under Delaware law and our certificate of incorporation, transactions that we enter into in which a director or officer has a conflict of interest are generally permissible so long as (1)&nbsp;the material facts relating to the director&#x2019;s or officer&#x2019;s relationship or interest as to the transaction are disclosed to our board of directors and a majority of our disinterested directors approves the transaction, (2)&nbsp;the material facts relating to the director&#x2019;s or officer&#x2019;s relationship or interest as to the transaction are disclosed to our stockholders and a majority of our disinterested stockholders approve the transaction or (3)&nbsp;the transaction is otherwise fair to us. Our certificate of incorporation also provides that any principal, officer, member, manager and/or employee of Parallel49 Equity or any entity that controls, is controlled by or under common control with Parallel49 Equity (other than any company that is controlled by us) or any investment funds managed by Parallel49 Equity will not be required to offer any transaction opportunity of which they become aware to us and could take any such opportunity for themselves or offer it to other companies in which they have an investment, unless such opportunity is offered to them solely in their capacities as our directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our ability to pay ongoing regular dividends to our stockholders is subject to the discretion of our board of directors and may be limited by our holding company structure and applicable provisions of Delaware law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We intend to pay ongoing regular cash dividends on our common stock. However, our board of directors may, in its sole discretion, change the amount or frequency of dividends or discontinue the payment of dividends entirely. In addition, because we are a holding company with no material direct operations, we are dependent on dividends and other payments from our operating subsidiaries to generate the funds necessary to pay dividends on our common stock. We expect to cause our subsidiaries to make distributions to us in an amount sufficient for us to pay dividends. However, their ability to make such distributions will be subject to their operating results, cash requirements and financial condition, the applicable provisions of Delaware law that may limit the amount of funds available for distribution and our ability to pay cash dividends,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compliance with covenants and financial ratios related to existing or future indebtedness and other agreements with third parties. In addition, each of the companies in our corporate chain must manage its assets, liabilities and working capital in order to meet all of its cash obligations, including the payment of dividends or distributions. As a consequence of these various limitations and restrictions, we may not be able to make, or may have to reduce or eliminate, the payment of dividends on our common stock. Any change in the level of our dividends or the suspension of the payment thereof could adversely affect the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Certain provisions of our organizational documents and other contractual provisions may make it difficult for stockholders to change the composition of our board of directors and may discourage hostile takeover attempts that some of our stockholders may consider to be beneficial.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Certain provisions of our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and bylaws may have the effect of delaying or preventing changes in control if our board of directors determines that such changes in control are not in the best interests of us and our stockholders. The provisions in our amended and restated certificate of incorporation and bylaws include, among other things, the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the ability of our board of directors to issue shares of preferred stock and to determine the price and other terms, including preferences and voting rights, of those shares without stockholder approval;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	following the time that the Tricor Funds and their affiliates cease to beneficially own a majority of our common stock, stockholder action may only be taken at a special or regular meeting and not by written consent, and special meetings may only be called by a majority of the total number of directors that we would have if there were no vacancies on our board of directors;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	advance notice procedures for nominating candidates to our board of directors or presenting matters at stockholder meetings;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	following the time that the Tricor Funds and their affiliates cease to beneficially own a majority of our common stock, removal of directors only for cause, and only upon the affirmative vote of 75% of our outstanding voting stock at a meeting of our stockholders called for that purpose;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	allowing only our board of directors to fill vacancies on our board of directors; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	27
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2022;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 12PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	following the time that the Tricor Funds and their affiliates cease to beneficially own a majority of our common stock, super
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;majority voting requirements to amend our bylaws and certain provisions of our certificate of incorporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have entered into a director nomination agreement (the &#x201C;Director Nomination Agreement&#x201D;) with the Tricor Funds that provides the Tricor Funds the right to designate nominees for election to our board of directors for so long as the Tricor Funds collectively beneficially own 5% or more of the total number of shares of our common stock then outstanding. The number of nominees that the Tricor Funds are entitled to designate under the Director Nomination Agreement bears the same proportion to the total number of members of our board of directors as the number of shares of common stock beneficially owned by the Tricor Funds bears to the total number of shares of common stock outstanding, rounded up to the nearest whole number. In addition, the Tricor Funds are entitled to designate the replacement for any of its board designees whose board service terminates prior to the end of such designee&#x2019;s term regardless of the Tricor Funds&#x2019; beneficial ownership at such time. The Tricor Funds also have the right to have their designees participate on committees of our board of directors, subject to compliance with applicable law and stock exchange rules. The Director Nomination Agreement will terminate at such time as the Tricor Funds collectively own less than 5% of our outstanding common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have elected in our certificate of incorporation not to be subject to Section&nbsp;203 of the Delaware General Corporation Law (the &#x201C;DGCL&#x201D;), an anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;takeover law. In general, Section&nbsp;203 prohibits a publicly held Delaware corporation from engaging in a business combination, such as a merger, with a person or group owning 15% or more of the corporation&#x2019;s voting stock for a period of three years following the date the person became an interested stockholder, unless (with certain exceptions) the business combination or the transaction in which the person became an interested stockholder is approved in a prescribed manner. Accordingly, we will not be subject to any anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;takeover effects of Section&nbsp;203. However, our certificate of incorporation contains provisions that have the same effect as Section&nbsp;203, except that they provide that the Tricor Funds, their affiliates (including any investment funds managed by Tricor) and any person that becomes an interested stockholder as a result of a transfer of 5% or more of our voting stock by the forgoing persons to such person are excluded from the &#x201C;interested stockholder&#x201D; definition in our certificate of incorporation and are therefore not subject to the restrictions set forth therein that have the same effect as Section&nbsp;203.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	While these provisions have the effect of encouraging persons seeking to acquire control of our company to negotiate with our board of directors, they could enable the board of directors to hinder or frustrate a transaction that some, or a majority, of our stockholders might believe to be in their best interests and, in that case, may prevent or discourage attempts to remove and replace incumbent directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, these provisions may frustrate or prevent any attempts by our stockholders to replace or remove our current management by making it more difficult for stockholders to replace members of our board of directors, which is responsible for appointing the members of our management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Any issuance of preferred stock could make it difficult for another company to acquire us or could otherwise adversely affect holders of our common stock, which could depress the price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our board of directors has the authority to issue preferred stock and to determine the preferences, limitations and relative rights of shares of preferred stock and to fix the number of shares constituting any series and the designation of such series, without any further vote or action by our stockholders. Our preferred stock could be issued with voting, liquidation, dividend and other rights superior to the rights of our common stock. The potential issuance of preferred stock may delay or prevent a change in control of us, discouraging bids for our common stock at a premium over the market price, and adversely affect the market price and the voting and other rights of the holders of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our business and stock price may suffer as a result of our lack of public company operating experience. In addition, if securities or industry analysts do not publish research or publish inaccurate or unfavorable research about our business, our stock price and trading volume could decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a newly public company. Our lack of public company operating experience may make it difficult to forecast and evaluate our future prospects. If we are unable to execute our business strategy, either as a result of our inability to effectively manage our business in a public company environment or for any other reason, our business, prospects, financial condition and results of operations may be harmed. In addition, as a new public company we have begun to obtain research coverage by securities and industry analysts. If one or more of the analysts who covers us downgrades our stock or publishes inaccurate or unfavorable research about our business, our stock price would likely
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	decline. If one or more of these analysts ceases coverage of us or fails to publish reports on us regularly, demand for our stock could decrease, which could cause our stock price and trading volume to decline.
</FONT>

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item 3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Legal Proceeding
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM3LEGALPROCEEDINGS_709436">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In previous filings, the Company highlighted that its industry is highly competitive and characterized by frequent intellectual property disputes.&nbsp; In October 2015, Gemalto S.A. filed a suit against the Company in the United States District Court for the Western District of Texas.&nbsp; The complaint alleges that the Company infringes a Gemalto patent by incorporating into the Company&#x2019;s products microchips that allegedly practice the EMV standard.&nbsp; Gemalto&#x2019;s patent will expire in 2017.&nbsp; The Company successfully moved to transfer the lawsuit to the District of Colorado, where it is currently pending.&nbsp; On January 28, 2016, the Company answered the complaint and filed counterclaims that the asserted patent is invalid and unenforceable, and that Gemalto&#x2019;s lawsuit is a &#x201C;sham&#x201D; intended to interfere with the Company&#x2019;s IPO and business relationships. &nbsp;Gemalto answered the Company&#x2019;s counterclaims on February 5, 2016.&nbsp; Discovery and motion practice is ongoing.&nbsp; On March 8, 2016, Gemalto provided specific infringement contentions, which&#x2014;contrary to the complaint&#x2019;s claim that all EMV-compliant products infringe&#x2014;only accuses CPI products that incorporate microchips supplied by two specific vendors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	No trial date has been set.&nbsp; Management believes Gemalto&#x2019;s claims are without merit and that the Company has strong legal and equitable defenses, plus meritorious counterclaims and indemnity rights. The Company intends to defend the suit vigorously.&nbsp; However, no assurance can be given that this matter will be resolved in our favor, and if determined adversely, whether indemnification will be received.&nbsp; Accordingly, it&nbsp;is not yet possible to reliably determine any potential liability that could result from this matter in the event of an adverse determination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In addition to the matter described above,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we are subject to routine legal proceedings in the ordinary course of business. We believe that the ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	29
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<EFX_MINE_SAFETY_DISCLOSURE>
<A NAME="FIS_MINE_SAFETY_DISCLOSURE"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item 4.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Mine Safety Disclosure
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM4MINESAFETYDISCLOSURES_405972">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Not applicable.

	PART I

<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_PARTII_694021">

	I

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item 5.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Market for Registrant&#x2019;s Common Equit
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM5MARKETFORREGISTRANTSCOMMONEQUITY_10">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	y, Related Stockholder Matters, and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Market Information for Common Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	has been
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	listed on the NASDAQ under the symbol &#x201C;PMTS&#x201D;, and the TSX
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the symbol &#x201C;PNT&#x201D; since October 9, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to our initial public offering, there was no public market for our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

This dividend is payable on April 7, 2016, to shareholders of record as of the close of business on March 17, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amount, declaration and payment of any future dividends will be subject to the discretion of the Company&#x2019;s Board of Directors who will evaluate the Company&#x2019;s dividend program from time to time based on factors it deems relevant.

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<SUP STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(4)
</SUP>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	computation of historical basic and diluted earnings per share attributable to continuing and discon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	tinued operations, see Note&nbsp;14 &#x201C;Earnings per Share&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	in Part II, Item 8. &#x201C;

</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<SUP STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(5)
</SUP>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	EBITDA is defined as income from continuing operations before interest expense, income taxes, depreciation and amortization. Adjusted EBITDA is defined as EBITDA plus adjustments for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	restructuring and other charges,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	cash compensation expense related to our phantom stock plan that was terminated in connection with our IPO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and other stock-based compensation expenses,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	performance bonuses in connection with the EFT Source acquisition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	loss on debt modification and early extinguishment, investment banking and related fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	foreign currency gain or loss,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	gain on purchase of ID Data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA are non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP financial measures that do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and are therefore unlikely to be comparable to similar measures presented by other issuers. EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA (collectively, the &#x201C;Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	) are the primary measures used by our management to evaluate operating performance. We believe the Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures are useful to investors because they provide a means to evaluate our operating performance on an ongoing basis using criteria that are used by our internal decision makers and because they are frequently used by investors and other interested parties when comparing companies in our industry that have different financing and capital structures and/or tax rates. We believe the Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures are meaningful measures because they present a transparent view of our recurring operating performance and allow management to readily view operating trends, perform analytical comparisons and identify strategies to improve operating performance. The Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures, however, are not measures of our liquidity or financial performance under GAAP and should not be considered as an alternative to net income (loss), income from operations, or any other performance measure derived in accordance with GAAP or as an alternative to cash
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	provided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	operating activities as a measure of our liquidity. The use of the Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures instead of net income (loss) has limitations as an analytical tool, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	: &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	they do not reflect our capital expenditures, or future requirements for capital expenditures or contractual commitments; they do not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for our working capital needs; they do not reflect the significant interest expense, or the cash requirements necessary to service interest or principal payments on our debt; although depreciation is a non-cash charge, the assets being depreciated will often have to be replaced in the future, and the non-GAAP Financial Measures do not reflect any cash requirements for such replacements; they are not adjusted for all non-cash income or expense items that are reflected in our statements of cash flows; and other companies in our industry may calculate these measures differently than we do, limiting their usefulness as comparative measures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	. The Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	GAAP Financial Measures are not necessarily comparable to other similarly titled captions of other companies due to potential inconsistencies in the methods of calculation.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following is a reconciliation of net income from continuing operations to EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA:
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Item 7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysi
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM7MANAGEMENTSDISCUSSIONANDANALYSIS_52">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	s of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	You should read the following discussion in conjunction with the consolidated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	financial statements and the notes to those statements included elsewhere in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	. This discussion and analysis contains forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	looking statements that involve risks, uncertainties and assumptions. Our actual results may differ materially from those anticipated in these forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	looking statements as a result of certain factors, including, but not limited to, those which are not within our control. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Risk Factors" and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#x201C;Forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Looking Statements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our 2014 reported results include four mo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	nths of results from EFT Source
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Company Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a leading provider of comprehensive Financial Payment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Card solutions in North America
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. In 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	more than 156.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Financial Payment Cards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	provided integrated card services to over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3,250 c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ard
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issuing banks and Prepaid Debit Card issuers. We have established a leading position in the Financial Payment Card market through more than 20&nbsp;years of experience and are focused primarily on this growing subsector of the financial technology market. Our customers are primarily leading national and regional banks, independent community banks, credit unions, managers of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	P
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	repaid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ebit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Card
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	programs, Group Service Providers and card processors. We serve a diverse set of over 4,000 direct and indirect customers, including many of the largest North American issuers of debit and credit cards such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, the largest global managers of Prepaid Debit Card programs, including InComm, Green Dot, Blackhawk Network and American Express, as well as thousands of independent community banks, credit unions, Group Service Providers and card processors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We serve our customers through a network of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	production and card services facilities, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	eight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	high
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	security facilities in North America that are each certified by one or more of the Payment Card Brands and Interac (in Canada) and, where required by our customers,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	certified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the PCI Security Standards Council. We have the largest such network of high
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	security production facilities in North America, allowing us to optimize our solutions offerings to serve the needs of our diverse and long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	term customer base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition to our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	eight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	North American facilities, we have two facilities in the United Kingdom that produce retail cards, such as gift and loyalty cards that are not issued on the networks of the Payment Card Brands, as well as provide personalization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, packaging and fulfillment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Highlights
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	; Factors and Trends Affecting Financial Performance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, net sales increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	43.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from 2014, to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	374.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, and income from operations increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	96.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from 2014, to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	67.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The operating profit margin for the year ended December 31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, an increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	490
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	basis points from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we generated $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	96.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million of Adjusted EBITDA, which represented an increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	77.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	% compared to the prior year, and net income from continuing operations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and Adjusted EBITDA margins of 8.4% and 25.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	%, respectively. Our 2014 reported results include four months of results from EFT Source. Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin are Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	GAAP Financial Measures. For a definition of Adjusted EBITDA and a reconciliation of Adjusted EBITDA to net income from continuing operations, the most comparable GAAP measure, see &#x201C;&#x2014;Key Performance Indicators&#x2014;EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA Margin.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we produced and shipped
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	156.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV cards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	65.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We anticipate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the continuation of the EMV conversion in the United States to drive continued strong demand for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ards. The upgrade by our customers from magnetic stripe and contactless Financial Payment Cards to EMV Financial Payment Cards has resulted in significant changes to our financial profile
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	increased net sales, cost of goods sold, gross profit and gross profit margin, and increased working capital investments to support increased net sales.&nbsp;&nbsp;EMV cards have a higher sales price than comparable magnetic stripe cards, but are also more expensive to produce,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as EMV cards include an integrated circuit chip assembly and may also include an RFID in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	lay assembly, in the case of a d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nterface EMV card
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On August&nbsp;17, 2015, we entered into a first lien credit agreement ("First Lien Credit Facility") with a syndicate of lenders providing for a $435.0&nbsp;million first lien term loan facility ("First Lien Term Loan") and a $40.0&nbsp;million revolving credit facility ("Revolving Credit Facility"). We used proceeds from the First Lien Credit Facility to pay off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	34
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the outstanding balance on our p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	revious credit facility of $158.4&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and to redeem 62,140 shares of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for an aggregate price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$276.7&nbsp;million. We incurred $17.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million of origination costs and associated discounts in conjunction with the establishment of the First Lien Credit Facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2015, we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	300.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million of outstanding indebtedness
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, net of unamortized debt and unamortized deferred financing costs of $12.5 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the First Lien Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On October&nbsp;15, 2015, we completed our IPO, issuing 15,000,000 shares of common stock at a price of $10.00 per share. The net proceeds of $142.5 million from the IPO, after issuance costs, were utilized to (i)&nbsp;redeem all of our remaining Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock for a total redemption price of $11.9 million, (ii)&nbsp;repay $112.5 million of the amount outstanding under the First Lien Term Loan, and (iii)&nbsp;terminate and settle all outstanding obligations due under the Phantom Stock Plan of $13.3 million. Deferred offering expenses of $7.2 million were included in capital deficiency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Segment Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our business consists of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the following
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reportable segments: U.S. Debit and Credit, U.S. Prepaid Debit and U.K. Limited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	U.S. Debit and Credit Segment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our U.S. Debit and Credit segment primarily produces Financial Payment Cards and provides integrated card services to card
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issuing banks in the United States. Products manufactured by this segment primarily include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV credit cards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ebit cards and Prepaid Debit Cards issued on the networks of the Payment Card Brands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	including general purpose reloadable,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gift,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	payroll and employee benefit, government disbursement, incentive, and transit cards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	),
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Private Label Credit Cards that are not issued on the networks of the Payment Cards Brands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and instant issuance systems.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This segment also provides a variety of integrated card services, including card personalization and fulfillment services and instant issuance services. The U.S. Debit and Credit segment includes our operations in Colorado, Indiana and Tennessee, which are each certified by multiple global Payment Card Brands and, where required by our customers,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	certified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	PCI Security Standards Council.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	U.S. Prepaid Debit Segment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our U.S. Prepaid Debit segment primarily provides integrated card services to Prepaid Debit Card issuers in the United States. Services provided include tamper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	evident security packaging services and card personalization and fulfillment services. This segment also produces Financial Payment Cards issued on the networks of the Payment Card Brands that are included in the tamper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	evident security packages mentioned above. The U.S. Prepaid Debit segment includes our operation in Minnesota which is certified by multiple global Payment Card Brands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is certified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the PCI Security Standards Council.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	U.K. Limited Segment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our U.K. Limited segment primarily produces retail
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cards, such as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gift and loyalty cards for customers in the United Kingdom and continental Europe. This segment also provides card personalization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, packaging
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and fulfillment services. The U.K. Limited segment includes our operations in Colchester, United Kingdom and Liverpool, United Kingdom. Neither of our operations in this segment is certified by any of the Payment Card Brands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	PCI Security Standards Council.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our operations in Ontario, Canada and Petersfield, United Kingdom
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and our corporate headquarters
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reflected in &#x201C;Other&#x201D;.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In July&nbsp;2015, we ceased operations at our Petersfield facility. The Petersfield facility is not material to our business. See Note&nbsp;19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Segment Reporting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D; in Part II, Item 8,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#x201C;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in this Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	certain additional information regarding our operating segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	35
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Key Performance Indicators
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To evaluate the performance of our business, in addition to our results of operations, we utilize a variety of financial and performance measures that we refer to as key performance indicators.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These key performance indicators include EMV Financial Payment Card Shipments,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	EMV Financial Payment Card Shipments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	EMV Financial Payment Card Shipments represent the total number of EMV Financial Payment Cards we ship during the period. We expect EMV Financial Payment Card shipments to increase due to the growth in the market for Financial Payment Cards and the continued conversion from non-EMV cards to be upgraded to EMV cards in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA Margin
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We use EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and Adjusted EBITDA margin as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	supplemental measure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of our performance. Adjusted EBITDA is also the basis for financial performance evaluation under our executive compensation programs. EBITDA is defined as income from continuing operations before interest expense, income taxes, depreciation and amortization. Adjusted EBITDA is defined as EBITDA plus adjustments for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	restructuring charges, stock-based compensation expense,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	performance bonus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	charges
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in connection with the EFT Source acquisition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	loss on debt modification and early extinguishment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investment banking and related fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and foreign exchange gain or loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. We believe that Adjusted EBITDA is an appropriate measure of operating performance because it eliminates the impact of expenses that do not relate to ongoing business performance. We also evaluate Adjusted EBITDA margin, which is Adjusted EBITDA as a percentage of net sales. We use Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin measures to benchmark our performance versus prior periods and our annual operating plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin are Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	GAAP Financial Measures. The Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	GAAP Financial Measures as presented in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are supplemental measures of our performance that are neither required by, nor presented in accordance with, GAAP. The Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	GAAP Financial Measures should not be considered as a substitute for GAAP metrics such as net income or any other performance measures derived in accordance with GAAP. Also, in the future we may incur expenses or charges such as those added back to calculate Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin. Our presentation of Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA margin should not be construed as an inference that our future results will be unaffected by unusual or nonrecurring items.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;See Part II, Item 6,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Selected Financial Data
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for more information regarding our use of Non-GAAP Financial Measures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	December&nbsp;31,

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(e)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Includes investment banking, advisory and related professional fees and expenses incurred in connection with the EFT Source acquisition and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	consideration of liquidity alternatives.
</FONT>
</P>
