<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	12. Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock has a par value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0.001
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share. The original Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock has an initial liquidation preference equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per outstanding share. In addition, the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock liquidation preference earns a dividend of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share per annum, payable when declared by the Board of Directors. Such dividends accrue on each share from the date of original issuance and accrue on a daily basis, whether or not declared. Such dividends are cumulative so that if such dividend in respect of any previous or current annual dividend period, at the annual 20% rate, has not been paid, the deficiency shall first be fully paid before any dividend or other distribution shall be paid or declared and set apart for the Common Stock. In the event of any liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the Company, the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock holders shall be entitled to receive, prior and in preference to any distributions of any of the Company&#x2019;s assets to the Common Stock holders, the value of the liquidation preference. If the distribution of such assets is insufficient to permit the payment to such holders, the distribution shall be distributed ratably among the holders of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock in proportion to the amount of such stock owned by each holder. The Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock had no voting rights.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company redeemed a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	64,809
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock at prices ranging between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3,950.33
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4,610.68
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	per share, including the redemption of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	62,140
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$276,688
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4,446.70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	per share, on August&nbsp;17, 2015 with proceeds from the Company&#x2019;s First Lien Credit Facility (see Note 10 &#x201C;Long-Term Debt and Credit Facility&#x201D;), and the redemption of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2,576
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$11,877
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4,610.68
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	per share, using proceeds from the Company&#x2019;s IPO (see Note 1 &#x201C;Business&#x201D;). Of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$288,565
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	redemption amount during the year ended December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$58,250
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	was treated as a return of capital and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$230,315
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	was treated as a dividend. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	outstanding shares of Series A Preferred Stock as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	549
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of Series A Preferred Stock at an estimated value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3,733.88
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	per share as part of the payment consideration for the EFT Acquisition. The Company did not redeem any shares of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	13. Stockholders&#x2019; Equity
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Common Stock
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Common Stock has a par value of $0.001 per share. Holders of common stock are entitled to receive dividends and distributions subject to the participation rights of holders of all classes of stock at the time outstanding, as such holders have prior rights as to dividends pursuant to the rights of any series of Preferred Stock. Upon any liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the Company, after required payments are made to holders of any series of Preferred Stock, any remaining assets of the Company will be distributed ratably to the holders of Common Stock. Holders of Common Stock are entitled to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	vote per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On September 3, 2015, the Company's Board of Directors approved a 22-for-1 stock split of our common stock and increased the number of authorized shares of common stock to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Upon the effective date of the stock split, each outstanding share of common stock and restricted common stock was divided into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of common stock or restricted common stock, as applicable. Shares of common stock available for issuance under the 2007 Stock Option Plan were increased accordingly. All of the share numbers, share prices and exercise prices have been retroactively adjusted to reflect the stock split in the Consolidated Financial Statements and these notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	On October&nbsp;15, 2015, the Company completed its IPO issuing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	15,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	shares of common stock at a price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	$10.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	per share. The net proceeds from the IPO, after issuance costs, were utilized to (i)&nbsp;redeem all of our remaining Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock for a total redemption price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	$11,877
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	(see Note 12 &#x201C;Series A Preferred Stock&#x201D;), (ii)&nbsp;repay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	$112,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	of the amount outstanding under the First Lien Term Loan (see Note 10 &#x201C;Long-Term Debt&#x201D;), and (iii)&nbsp;terminate and settle all outstanding obligations due under the Phantom Stock Plan of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13,268
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	(see Note 18 &#x201C;Phantom Stock Plan&#x201D;). The proceeds of the IPO were net of deferred offering expenses of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	$7,196
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	and are reflected in &#x201C;Capital deficiency&#x201D; in the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Employee Notes Receivable
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Included in &#x201C;Stockholders&#x2019; Deficit&#x201D; in the Consolidated Balance Sheets are promissory notes received in connection with equity issuances of Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock and Common Stock to certain employees made during 2011 and earlier years. The notes receivable accrued interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per annum and were paid in bimonthly installments. The principal balances of the notes were due upon the employee&#x2019;s termination, the sale of the Company, upon any distributions, or at such time that the employee failed to own the underlying shares.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company did not issue any new Employee notes, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$108, $19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of employee notes were repaid, respectively. As of December 31, 2015 there were no outstanding employee notes receivable, as they were all repaid during the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$108
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of employee notes receivable were outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	14. Earnings per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Basic or diluted earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net earnings or loss by the weighted-average number of ordinary shares outstanding during the period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted EPS attributable to continuing and discontinued operations:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The potentially dilutive effect of the outstanding stock options of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,257,450
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	627,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	649,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, have been excluded from the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding as their inclusion would be antidilutive. As further described in Note&nbsp;1 &#x201C;Business&#x201D;, the cumulative dividends in arrears related to Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock were paid in conjunction with the Company&#x2019;s IPO. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, cumulative dividends in arrears related to the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock in aggregate was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$191,208
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	15. Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Commitments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company leases real property for its facilities under noncancelable operating lease agreements. Land and facility leases expire at various dates between 2016 and 2023 and contain various provisions for rental adjustments and renewals. All of these leases require the Company to pay property taxes, insurance and normal maintenance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the normal course of business, the Company also enters into non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cancellable agreements to purchase goods and services, including production equipment and information technology systems.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company incurred rent expense under non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cancellable operating leases during the years ended December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3,518
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3,320
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3,096
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Asset retirement obligations relate to legal obligations associated with the removal of all leasehold improvements at the end of the lease term. The Company records all asset retirement obligations, which primarily relate to &#x201C;make
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	good
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	clauses in operating leases, for its leased property containing leasehold improvements. The liability, reported within other long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	term liabilities, is accreted through charges to operating expenses. If the asset retirement obligation is settled for an amount other than the carrying amount of the liability, the Company recognizes a gain or loss on settlement. The Company incurred accretion expense during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$29
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$53
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company&#x2019;s asset retirement obligations included in &#x201C;Other long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	term liabilities&#x201D; in the Consolidated Balance Sheets were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$613
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$911
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In October 2015, Gemalto S.A. filed a suit alleging that the Company infringes on a Gemalto patent by incorporating microchips into the Company&#x2019;s products.&nbsp; Gemalto&#x2019;s patent will expire in 2017. Discovery and motion practice is ongoing.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company believes Gemalto&#x2019;s claims are without merit and it has strong legal and equitable defenses, plus meritorious counterclaims and indemnity rights.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company intends to defend the suit vigorously.&nbsp;Due to the current stage of the matter, the Company has concluded the risk of loss is not reasonably possible or estimable and no accrual has been recognized as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;">
	In addition to the matter described above,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Company is subject to routine legal proceedings in the ordinary course of business. The Company believes that the ultimate resolution of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	16. Employee Benefit Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company maintains a qualified defined
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	contribution plan under the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code Section
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	401(k), which covers substantially all employees in the United States who meet certain eligibility requirements. Under the plan, participants may defer their salary subject to statutory limitations and may direct the contributions among various investment accounts. The Company matches
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the participant&#x2019;s first 3% of deferrals and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the next 2% deferral percentage. The Company&#x2019;s portion is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	vested at the time of the match.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The aggregate amounts charged to expense in connection with the plan were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1,049
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$824
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$908
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	17. Stock Option Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	CPI Card Group&nbsp;Inc. Omnibus Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;In conjunction with the completion of the IPO, the Company adopted the Omnibus Plan pursuant to which cash and equity based incentives may be granted to participating employees, advisors and directors. The Company has reserved
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of common stock for issuance under the Omnibus Plan. During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company granted awards of stock options for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	795,450
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	shares of common stock at an exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	per share, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	770,450
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	options granted in connection with the IPO. The options will generally vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	33.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	33.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	33.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	on the second, third and fourth anniversary dates following the grant date.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Outstanding and exercisable stock options under the Omnibus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	are as follows:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Compensation expense for the Omnibus Plan for the year ended December 31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$239
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2015, the total unrecognized compensation expense related to unvested options was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2,470
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which the Company expects to recognize over an estimated weighted average period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	years.&nbsp;&nbsp;The aggregate intrinsic value of stock option awards outstanding under the Omnibus Plan as of December 31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$525
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.40%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	%
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Risk-free interest rate
</FONT>

</DIV>
	1.8
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.40%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	1.3

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Expected term &#x2013;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company estimated the expected term based on the average of the weighted-average vesting period and the contractual term of the stock option awards by utilizing the &#x201C;simplified method&#x201D;, as the Company does not have sufficient available historical data to estimate the expected term of these stock option awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Volatility &#x2013; The expected volatility percentage of 36.7% was based on a peer group average historical volatility over the expected option term.&nbsp;&nbsp;The peer group was based on financial technology companies that completed an initial public offering of common stock from 2007 through 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	23
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Risk-free interest rate &#x2013; The risk-free interest rate of 1.8% was determined by using the United States Treasury rate for the period that coincided with the expected option term described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Dividend yield &#x2013; The Company&#x2019;s expected annual dividend yield in the current year was determined based on an estimated annual dividend divided by the expected share price for the Company&#x2019;s common stock on the initial public offering date.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	CPI Holdings I, Inc. Amended and Restated 2007 Stock Option Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In 2007, the Company&#x2019;s Board of Directors adopted the CPI Holdings I, Inc. Amended and Restated 2007 Stock Option Plan (the &#x201C;Option Plan&#x201D;). Under the provisions of the Option Plan, stock options and restricted stock awards may be granted to employees, directors, and consultants at an exercise price greater than or equal to the fair market value of a share on the date the option is granted.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As a result of the Company&#x2019;s adoption of its Omnibus Plan in conjunction with its IPO, as further described above, no further awards will be made under the Option Plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;The outstanding stock options have a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year life and vest, as noted, in each respective grant letter. All stock options are nonqualified.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Outstanding and exercisable stock options under the Option Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Compensation expense and unrecorded compensation expense related to options previously granted under the Option Plan, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, were de minimis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The aggregate intrinsic value of stock option awards outstanding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and exercisable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	under the Option Plan as of December 31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4,925
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,495
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company issued 191,664 restricted shares of common stock to executives of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The awards contain conditions associated with continued employment or service.&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms of the non-vested restricted shares of common stock provide voting and regular dividend rights to the holders of the restricted shares of common stock, and accordingly are included in weighted-average shares outstanding in the Company&#x2019;s basic earnings per share calculation.&nbsp;&nbsp;See Note 14 &#x201C;Earnings per Share&#x201D;.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon vesting, the restrictions lapse and the shares are considered issued and outstanding.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restricted shares vest over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	F-

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Total compensation expense related to the unvested restricted shares of common stock awards was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$646
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	for the year ended December 31, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2015, there was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,171
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	of total remaining unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested restricted shares of common stock that will be recognized over a weighted average period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	18. Phantom Stock Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2012, the Company&#x2019;s Board of Directors adopted the CPI Acquisition,&nbsp;Inc. Phantom Stock Plan (&#x201C;Phantom Stock Plan&#x201D;) to provide incentive compensation to certain key employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;In conjunction with the Company&#x2019;s IPO, the Phantom Stock Plan was terminated and all outstanding liabilities were settled under the plan. . During the year ended December 31, 2015, payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$13,892
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were made under the plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	liability existed as of December 31, 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December 31, 2014, the liability reported in &#x201C;Other long-term liabilities&#x201D; in the Consolidated Balance Sheet was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$5,144
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under the terms of the Phantom Stock Plan, holders of an award were entitled to a cash payment equal to the difference between the fair market value of the award, as defined in the agreement, at the time of exercise and the award&#x2019;s exercise price. The Company measured the liability at intrinsic value, with changes in the intrinsic value of the liability recognized as expense each year in the Consolidated Statements of Operations and Comprehensive Income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company recognized compensation expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8,748
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$4,534
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$610
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively, related to this plan.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	19. Segment Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company has identified reportable segments as those consolidated subsidiaries that represent 10% or more of its revenue, EBITDA (as defined below), or total assets or subsidiaries which the Company believes information about the segment would be useful to the readers of the financial statements from a qualitative perspective. The Company&#x2019;s chief operating decision maker is its Chief Executive Officer who is charged with management of the Company and is responsible for the evaluation of operating performance and decision making about the allocation of resources to operating segments based on measures such as revenue and EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EBITDA is the primary measure used by the Company&#x2019;s chief operating decision maker to evaluate segment operating performance. As the Company uses the term, EBITDA is defined as income from continuing operations before interest expense, income taxes, depreciation and amortization. The Company&#x2019;s chief operating decision maker believes EBITDA is a meaningful measure and is superior to available U.S.&nbsp;GAAP measures as it represents a transparent view of the Company&#x2019;s operating performance that is unaffected by fluctuations in property, equipment and leasehold improvement additions. The Company&#x2019;s chief operating decision maker uses EBITDA to perform periodic reviews and comparison of operating trends and identify strategies to improve the allocation of resources amongst segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company&#x2019;s reportable segments are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</TD>

	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	U.S. Debit and Credit

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 16.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;WIDTH:2PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	U.S. Prepaid Debit
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 16.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:2PT;WIDTH:2PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	U.K. Limited
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The U.S. Debit and Credit segment primarily produces Financial Payment Cards and provides integrated card services to card
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issuing banks in the United States. Products manufactured by this segment primarily include EMV and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	EMV credit cards, debit cards and prepaid debit cards issued on the networks of the Payment Card Brands, private label credit cards that are not issued on the networks of the Payment Cards Brands (including general purpose reloadable, gift, payroll and employee benefit, government disbursement, incentive, and transit cards), and instant issuance systems. This segment also provides a variety of integrated card services, including card personalization and fulfillment services and instant issuance services. The U.S. Debit and Credit segment includes the Company&#x2019;s operations in Colorado, Indiana and Tennessee, which are each certified by multiple global Payment Card Brands and, where required by the Company&#x2019;s customers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	certified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with the standards of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	PCI Security Standards Council. These operating segments have been aggregated into a single reportable segment due to similarities in the nature of the products and services sold by these subsidiaries, a common customer base, the substantial degree of integration and redundancy across the segments, and utilization of centrally shared sales, marketing, quality and planning departments. Separate information about these segments would not be useful to the readers of the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The U.S. Prepaid Debit segment primarily provides integrated card services to prepaid debit card issuers in the United States. Services provided include tamper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	evident security packaging services and card personalization and fulfillment services. This segment also produces financial payment cards issued on the networks of the Payment Card Brands that are included in the tamper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	evident security packages mentioned above. The U.S. Prepaid Debit segment includes the Company&#x2019;s operation in Minnesota which is certified by multiple global Payment Card Brands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is certified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to be in compliance with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the standards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the PCI Security Standards Council.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The U.K. Limited segment primarily produces retail cards, such as gift and loyalty cards for customers in the United Kingdom and continental Europe. This segment also provides card personalization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, packaging
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and fulfillment services. The U.K. Limited segment includes the Company&#x2019;s operations in Colchester, United Kingdom and Liverpool,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	United Kingdom. Neither of the Company&#x2019;s operations in this segment is certified by any of the Payment Card Brands,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nor are they PCI certified.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The &#x201C;Other&#x201D; category includes the Company&#x2019;s corporate headquarters and less significant operating segments that derive their revenue from the production of Financial Payment Cards and retail gift cards in Canada (CPI&#x2014;Canada) and the U.K. (CPI&#x2014;Petersfield). For additional information regarding the Company&#x2019;s decision to shut down the CPI&#x2014;Petersfield facility during the third quarter of 2015, see Note&nbsp;1 &#x201C;Business&#x201D;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

	Product net sales include the design and production of Financial

	Payment Cards, in contact EMV, d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	nterface EMV, contactless and magnetic stripe formats. The Company also generates product revenue from the sale of Card@Once
</FONT>

	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	instant issuance systems, Private Label Credit Cards, and retail gift cards.

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Services net sales include revenue from the personalization and fulfillment of Financial Payment Cards, the provision of tamper
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	evident security packaging, providing fulfillment services to Prepaid Debit Card program managers and software as a service personalization of instant issuance debit cards. The Company also generates service revenue from personalizing retail gift cards (primarily in Canada and the United Kingdom) and from click
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	fees generated from the Company&#x2019;s patented card design software, known as MYCA, which provides customers and cardholders the ability to design cards on the internet and customize cards with individualized digital images.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	20. Quarterly Financial Information (Unaudited)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:18PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Summarized quarterly results for the years ended

	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were as follows:

	year-to-date periods ended September 30, June 30, and March 31, 2015, respectively, and an increase (decrease) to our previously reported Cost of Sales from products and an associated

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	21. Subsequent Events
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On February 24, 2016, the Board of Directors approved a dividend of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0.045
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share. This dividend is payable on April 7, 2016, to stockholders of record as of the close of business on March 17, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On March 2, 2016, the Company granted awards of stock options and restricted stock units under the Omnibus Plan for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	400,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	23
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2,912
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The stock option awards have an exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share and vest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	33.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on October 9, 2017,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	33.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on October 9, 2018 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	33.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on October 9, 2019.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restricted stock unit awards contain conditions associated with continued employment or service.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restrictions lapse on the vesting date, at which time shares of common stock will be issued to the award recipients.&nbsp;&nbsp;The restricted stock unit awards have a grant date fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$7.91
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share and vest on March 2, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Item 9.

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item 9A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 22PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Controls and Procedure
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM9ACONTROLSANDPROCEDURES_60624">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_S44792299">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_S108838989">
</A>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_S44792300">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We maintain disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act")), that are designed to assure that information required to be disclosed in our Exchange Act reports is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC's rules and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosures. As required by Exchange Act Rule 13a-15(b), as of the end of the period covered by this Quarterly Report, under the supervision and with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, we evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures. Based on this evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were ineffective as of December 31, 2015 due to the unremediated material weakness in our internal controls over financial reporting described below. Notwithstanding the identified material weakness, management believes the consolidated financial statements included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K fairly represent in all material respects our financial condition, results of operations and cash flows at and for the periods presented in accordance with U.S. GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Limitations on Effectiveness of Controls
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, do not expect that our disclosure controls and procedures will prevent all errors and fraud. In designing and evaluating the disclosure controls and procedures, management recognized that any controls and procedures, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance of achieving the desired control objectives. Further, the design of a control system must reflect the fact that there are resource constraints, and management necessarily was required to apply its judgment in evaluating the cost-benefit relationship of possible controls and procedures. Because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, within the Company have been detected. These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in decision-making can be faulty, and that breakdowns can occur because of simple error or mistake. Additionally, controls can be circumvented by the individual acts of some persons, by collusion of two or more people, or by management&#x2019;s override of the control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The design of any system of controls also is based in part upon certain assumptions about the likelihood of future events, and there can be no assurance that any design will succeed in achieving its stated goals under all potential future conditions. Over time, controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate. Because of the inherent limitations in a cost-effective control system, misstatements due to error or fraud may occur and not be detected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_S44792301">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Management&#x2019;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	This Annual Report does not include a report of management&#x2019;s assessment regarding internal control over financial reporting or an attestation report of our independent registered public accounting firm due to a transition period established by the rules of the SEC for newly public companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:18PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_S44792302">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As previously reported on our Form S-1 effective October 8, 2015 and quarterly report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended September 30, 2015, we have identified material weaknesses in our internal control over financial reporting related to a current lack of finance expertise that could result in a failure to properly account for non-routine and complex transactions in accordance with GAAP.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	With the oversight of senior management, we have taken steps to remediate the underlying causes of these material weaknesses, primarily through the development and implementation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	59
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:5PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	formal policies, improved processes, as well as the hiring of additional finance personnel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, including the appointment of our current Chief Financial Officer in June 2015 and Chief Accounting Officer in March 2016, both of whom are certified public accountants, and are familiar with the rules and regulations applicable to public companies, including the requirements of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, from their previous experience in substantive financial roles with other public companies.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We will continue to monitor the effectiveness of these remediation efforts as we consider in future reporting periods whether such control deficiencies have been fully remediated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;COLOR:#000000;">
	Except for the continued remediation efforts described herein, there has been no change in our internal controls over financial reporting during our most recent quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 46.8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:11PT;TEXT-INDENT: -46.8PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item 10.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 22PT 0PT 0PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Directors, Executiv
</FONT>
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM10DIRECTORSEXECUTIVE_510323">

	e Officers and Corporate Governance

	The information required by this Item is expected to be in our definitive Proxy Statement for the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the &#x201C;Proxy Statement&#x201D;), which we expect to be filed within 120 days of the end of our fiscal year ended December 31, 2015 and is incorporated herein by reference.

<EFX_COMPENSATION>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;COLOR:#000000;">
	KNOWN BY ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that the individuals whose signatures appear below hereby constitute and appoint Steve Montross and David Brush, and each of them severally, as his or her true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents with full power of substitution and resubsitution for him or her and in his or her name, place and stead in any and all capacities to sign any and all amendments to this Annual Report on Form 10-K and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto, and other documents in connection therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, granting unto said attorneys-in-fact and agents, full power and authority to do or perform each and every act and thing requisite and necessary to be done in connection therewith, as fully to all intents and purposes as he or she might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all that said attorneys-in-fact and agents or any of them, or of his substitute or substitutes, may lawfully do to cause to be done by virtue hereof.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:5.88235294117647%;MARGIN-RIGHT:5.88235294117647%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9.9PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<A NAME="PMTS-20151231EX3112E321E_HTM__GOBACK">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Exhibit 31.1
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	CERTIFICATION
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	PURSUANT TO SECTION 302
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9.9PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	I,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Steven Montross
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;MARGIN:10PT 0PT 0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	Exhibit 31.2

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 302
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-TRANSFORM:UPPERCASE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9.9PT 0PT 0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	I,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	David Brush
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;MARGIN:10PT 0PT 0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9.9PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	In connection with the Annual Report of CPI Card Group Inc. (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;) on Form 10-K for the period end
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	ed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	December 31, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#x201C;Report&#x201D;), we Steven Montross, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, and David Brush, Chief Financial Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to our knowledge, that:
</FONT>
</P>
